intro: Whitleya, commonly known as the silver leaf tree, is a tropical plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, glossy, dark green leaves that have a distinctive silvery underside. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, often in shades of white and pink. Its roots are fibrous and can be used in traditional medicine. Whitleya thrives in humid climates and requires well-drained soil to flourish.
